Hacking, Baphomet and the real time internet
Hi. I am an engineer who builds paradigm-shifting tech and leads others to do the same. I love using the enormity of the Internet to bring people together, whether as CTO of Obama for America, CTO at Threadless.com, or on my own projects. You can often find me playing with new technology, looking for something to hack, or enjoying life in Chicago with my amazing wife, Hiromi. Check out my homepage and follow me on twitter.

Sad Google day.
Posted on Mar 28, 2007

Usually when I blog about Google, I am happy. but today it is a sad sad Google day. For the first time since the days of metacrawler, a search for Harper Reed doesn't return one of my sites as the first hit. This really hurts. I guess I have been slacker at my SEO. Gotta jump back up there. I hope that harperreed.com drops once Google reindexes and notices that their title isn't harper/reed anymore. I just need to make millions of dollars and buy harperreed.com. sad!

UPDATE:Â  I am no longer 2nd. As i expected, harperreed.com dropped once people stopped linking to it in the news. So now i dominate the first page of results. YES. Now i just need to get back on the first page for harper.
